name: Asarum europum
Relationship: Asarum Canadensa - Wild Ginger. (Colds, followed by amenorrhoea and gastroenteritis. Suppressed colds.) Compare: Ipecac., especially in diarrhoea; Silica; Nux; China.

Eyes: Better, in cold air or water; worse, sunlight and wind
Darting pains in eyes after operations
Fever: Chilliness, single parts get icy cold
Stomach: Loss of appetite, flatulence, eructation, and vomiting
Female: Menses too early, long lasting, black
Violent pain in small of back
Modalities: Worse: in cold dry weather; penetrating sounds
Better: from washing; in damp and wet weather
Mind: Thoughts vanish, with drawing pressure in forehead
SENSIBILITY INCREASED, EVEN FROM MERE IMAGINATION
Back: Paralytic pain in muscles of nape of neck
Head: Compressive pain
Tension of scalp; hair painful
Coryza, with sneezing
Rectum: STRINGS of odorless, yellow mucus pass from bowels

details: A remedy for nervous affections, loss of energy, with excessive ERETHISM. SCRATCHING ON SILK OR LINEN OR PAPER UNBEARABLE. Pains and spasmodic muscular actions. Nervous deafness and asthenopia. Cold shivers from any emotion. Feels as if parts were pressed together. Tension and contractive sensations. ALWAYS FEELS COLD.
